title: 1-Separated Set
content: A point set is 1-separated if all pairwise distances are at least 1. This is equivalent to requiring that unit disks centered at the points are non-overlapping.

title: Pairs Within Distance
content: The count of unordered pairs (i,j) with d(xᵢ,xⱼ) ≤ t in a 1-separated point set. This is the quantity conjectured to be maximized by the triangular lattice.

title: Triangular Lattice Optimality
content: Among all 1-separated n-point sets in ℝ², the triangular lattice maximizes the number of pairs at distance ≤ t for each t ≥ 1.

title: Known Lattice Values
content: The triangular lattice has f(1) = 6 nearest neighbors, f(√3) = 12 within distance √3, and f(3) = 18 within distance 3. These are the coordination shells.

title: Hexagonal Packing Connection
content: The triangular lattice gives the densest packing of unit disks in ℝ² (Thue 1910, Tóth 1940). This problem extends the optimality to pair distance counting.

title: Problem Statement Caveat
content: The original problem as written on erdosproblems.com contains at least one typo. The formalization follows the most natural mathematical interpretation.
